welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: "Look at three of your favorite websites. How do they use color and typography to create a mood or tone? Do fonts or colors affect how 'professional' or 'playful' a site feels?"

aim.data: Objective: Use `color`, `font-size`, `font-family`, and `line-height` in CSS to control text appearance and apply appropriate CSS units.

review.data:
Recall CSS placement (inline, internal, external). Ask: How do we apply styles to all `

` elements?

relevant.data: Mini-lecture and live demo: `color`, `font-size`, `font-family`, `line-height`, units (`px`, `em`, `%`, `rem`), and Google Fonts integration.

interactive.data: Students create a mock blog post and style it with fonts, colors, sizes, and line height using CSS. Must use two font families and relative units.

ownership.data: Students explore Google Fonts, choose one, apply it to their CSS, comment on unit choices, and push their site to GitHub.

resonate.data: Exit ticket: 'Which CSS unit do you find most flexible or confusing?' and 'What makes a font effective or ineffective?'

supplies.data: Computers, WebStorm, browser, GitHub, projector, Google Fonts, design journal.
